text: a cumin lamb stir-fry it's one of those
restaurant dishes where you think I
can't make this at home but you know
what you can and it's gonna be even
better than anything you can get for
take-out it's just a matter of finding
the right ingredients that's what's
gonna make the dish taste really
authentic so the one ingredient that you
should really try to find for this dish
Szechuan peppercorns that's what really
gives it the intense heat also has a bit
of a woodsy flavor of course you can use
regular black peppercorns too they'll be
fine but maybe just not quite as good so
I've got Szechuan peppercorns and I've
toasted them and I also have toasted
whole cumin seeds and now I'm just gonna
grind them up not finely ground just
pound them of it you can use any kind of
boneless lamb for this I've tested it
with stew meat I've used shoulder meat
this is leg of lamb that's good too and
so I'm just gonna add my cumin and
Szechuan peppercorns I'm also gonna use
pre-ground cumin this is cumin lamb so I
want to be extra cumin II and this is
not toasted so this one has a toasted
cumin flavor this one has a sweeter
flavor so you want both and just regular
old salt and these are just small red
dried chilies if you can't get the whole
chilies you could just use a big fat
pinch of chili flakes whatever you can
find that's fine too these are really
nice though because not only do they
have the heat they also have a little
bit of sweetness if you have time to do
this ahead even just 15 minutes ahead
it's gonna help but you can also do it
right before you stir fry it the trick
to stir frying in a skillet instead of a
wok is to get your pan super hot before
you add the ingredients let it go for
about five or six minutes and that way
when you add everything it's gonna get
brown and it's not gonna steam I'm gonna
use peanut oil peanut oil has a nice
high smoke point although it is smoking
that's a lot Pam that's good okay so
quick I've got scallions
and onion you see how everything is
starting to brown immediately that's
what you want this is the desired
reaction so this is gonna go really
quickly you want to have a bowl next to
the pan and then as stuff starts to get
brown just put it right in the bowl you
just want to keep it moving so that
nothing gets too Brown so this is what
I'm looking for in my onions I don't
want them to be falling apart I don't
want them to be super tender they should
have some texture still now I'm gonna do
my lamb now I'm gonna add the garlic soy
sauce and I've got Chinese cooking
sherry and that all becomes my sauce and
then once that cooks off for a few
seconds I'm just gonna add my onions
back to the pan for freshness scallion
tops and this is really nice this is
just cilantro this is pretty spicy so it
kind of tones down that as well the
cilantro stems soften but there's still
a little bit of texture a little bit of
brightness see how fast that goes once
you have everything ready and now you
can serve it so I just have regular
white rice you could use brown rice this
is just like your everyday stir-fry
except with bigger more intense and
spicier flavors spicy
